Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at good price”
Reviews.Author: suelondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice. Lovely lobby area that always seemed to be busy and a nice atmosphere. Nice bar which really kicks into life at weekends and the breakfast room is also nice. The rooms are nice and clean. We booked an apartment after reading it as a tip on here and the extra space was good, I feel a normal room may have beena bit snug. The apartment came with a good size bedroom, large bathroom and a small kitchen with a breakfast bar, tv and single sofa. Breakfast was good, lots of choices. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. We went at Easter and they hung an easter treats bag on everyone's door - nice touch. Location is really good, just 10 minute walk to Hackescher Markt and lots of bars and restaurants close to hotel if you don't want to wander far. Would definately recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Functional but pleasant, clean, helping staff, wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: doruf
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by my travel agent, based on reports of other Israeli visitors. The main reason, she said, is it being located in the middle of town (mitte) currently the most "in" because of the vicinity of the main museums, shopping centers, distractions a.s.o. We were not exactly suited because we are more inclined with what is called "serious" events, opera, concerts etc and these are far away, in the western side. The room was very functional, seemingly suitable for business people coming for a short stay. However they were many pairs obviously coming for pleasure and even pairs with children. The hotel is well located near public transport stations (underground, buses and trams). The breakfast was really wonderful and for us was enough until early dinner. Price was good enough and we paid for 8 B&B days, less than 800 €.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Frans-on-wheels
Reviews.Content: Many people happy here, not me. Make sure you don't get the rooms that end with x03. You're at the end of the building in a squeezed space. Very unfriendly desk people not willing to help, poor internet. Better take your business somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MoCoLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Amano for 3 nights very recently and couldn't fault it for the price we paid. Great budget hotel - functional and modern. It's no frills in a truly modern way. The rooms aren't big but why would you need anything larger on a 3 night city break? The shower was excellent (always a deciding factor with hotels for me!!) and everything required for a comfortable stay was supplied. The room was spotlessly clean with a very comfortable bed.The staff were all very pleasant and helpful and when we asked for extra pillows they arrived very promptly. Breakfasts were excellent with plenty of choice and the dining room was stylish and pleasant. The location of the hotel was ideal for us as museum island is only a pleasant 15 minute walk away and Hoffe is a 10 minute stroll with a great choice of eating places. Would suggest taking an Insider Walking Tour as a start to a Berlin break (starts a 10 minute stroll from the hotel). It's 4 hours long but covers all the important sites that side of Berlin and gives you a good starting point for deciding what you want to do for the rest of your stay. The guides are very knowledgeable and full of interesting info that you wouldn't normally pick up. We will revisit Berlin very soon as it's a fantastically varied and interesting city and will definitely stay at The Amano again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: julie00031
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Amano recently and could not find fault with it. The staff are all very helpful and efficient, the room was clean, comfortable and modern and the breakfast was good with a large choice which would cater for anyone. The hotel is situated not far from the centre (about a 15 to 20 min walk) and if returning to Berlin I would definitely stay here again. If going to Berlin on holiday be sure to take the city centre bus tour which has 20 stops and headphones for commentry about the various places of interest on the tour, you can hop on and off the buses all day as there is a bus every 10 mins and your ticket lasts for 2 days which is just as well as we only got off on 2 stops and that was one of the days gone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anonnana
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, not far from train stations, staff very friendly, room large, spotlessly clean, breakfast very good.

Reviews.Title: “A five star hotel for three star prices.”
Reviews.Author: sbandrm
Reviews.Content: What a find! The only way we could fault this place was that a couple of us were travelling with friends and the showers haveno curtain and are see through! Delicious breakfast, great bar and neighbourhood. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: SeaShantySong
Reviews.Content: Has got everything you need for a business/couples trip (didn't try family; didn't have family vibes but might be no problem either): * clean, tasteful no-nonsense rooms * representative lobby * great location for doing business in Mitte and surroundings * perfect location to enjoy Berlin's nightlife

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: Kpfromuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights over New Years Eve and loved the location, the modern and clean rooms (we stayed in an apartment) and the buffet breakfast. We walked pretty much everywhere from the hotel and loved the surrounding restaurants - although if you want the u-bahn is only 3 mins walk away from the hotel. We would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gillw823
Reviews.Content: very pleased with hotel in prime position excellent breakfast 5 euros for glass of wine in hotel bar 4 euros for half pint san miguel bit pricey but all drinks in berlin were more than we would pay here. fantastic city

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel with lively but smokey bar”
Reviews.Author: S0crates
Reviews.Content: If you thought hotel bars were boring try the Hotel Amano which has a lively bar with great live entertainment or DJ. It was packed with a young trendy crowd every night, open til late, serving cocktails and excellent selection of spirits - but, be warned, smoking is allowed which you may love or hate. Amano is a stylish, well-designed hotel with immaculate en-suite rooms, though standard rooms are a bit on the small side - space enough to get round the bed but not much more. Smart, very clean, modern, with a comfortable good-size bed and very sound-proof so noise form the street barely penetrates. The bathroom is well-designed in a clean modernist style with bath and shower over. The buffet breakfast is also excellent and is available until 11, which is just as well if you've been in the bar til late! However breakfast costs 15 euro which is OK if you've got a good appetite but expensive if you only want a coffee and croissant. There's a large lobby/lounge and a roof terrasse (which I guess would be nice in summer). It's position is great - close to Hackescher Market for trendy shops and bars, and is well-served by public transport. There's a great Italian restaurant just 50 metres down Augustrasse (Al Contadino sotte le Stelle) or there's the Transit Restaurant just up the road on Rosenthaler which is much cheaper and noisy but serves tasty Asian food. Hotel Amano is also only a short walk to Museum Island and a bit further to Unter den Linden - the main street which runs up to the Brandenburg Gate. The service was first rate by friendly staff who mostly spoke good English. We would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with free wifi!”
Reviews.Author: Jpaesq
Reviews.Content: Chose on recommendation from a colleague. Free wifi, bike rental, and iPods with audio tour of Berlin! They are friendly, thoughtful, and there is a nice bar as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice”
Reviews.Author: Zachos88
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is very nice, next to the August strasse were you can find a plethora of galleries. As soon as you enter the hotel's lobby you ll be excited with your choice! The rooms are very clean an pretty as well despite the fact that my room was a bit small for its price. On the other hand, my room was very quiet even though it was on the road's side. I guess that the rooms that have view of the inside garden should be great too! Furthermore, the service was really nice and the breakfast as well! Finally, if you are a bike person, I would not recommend to rent one from the hotel, even though they look beautiful the are very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in town?”
Reviews.Author: ThomasStensrud
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just between Rosenthaler Platz and the Hackesche Höfe - terrific location. Breakfast buffet is way above average and the overall value is good. Relatively small rooms with some noise from the streets. However, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutiege Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: mctheworldcitizen
Reviews.Content: Clean, design and cool, with a perfect Amano bar. Decorations of the rooms are nice and cool. I also like the location. Walking to the stores and restaurants. And also like to add that the rooms are more better then my expectations up to the price.

Reviews.Title: “Amano provides quality but is operated as a cash-cow”
Reviews.Author: MrsPiket
Reviews.Content: The Amano design hotel is well located in Mitte, Alexanderplatz, Museum Insel and Hackescher Mark are at walking distance. Staffs are friendly and helpful. The stairs and corridor next to the Amano café stank of cigarette smoke. The room was odourless. With well over 100 Euros a night without breakfast, the hotel does not come cheap. Amano provides quality but is operated as a cash-cow. When a major Berlin event takes place Amano prices double immediately. Because of its central location the hotel is often fully booked. The room was OK and clean, with good beds and no-nonsense furnishing. The window can be opened. Complimentary cable internet in the room. At 15 Euros per person the breakfast is pricey. We booked a one-room apartment with kitchenette and made breakfast ourselves. Next to the hotel are a supermarket and a bakery. The mini-kitchen is adequately equipped yet only suitable for modest self-catering like making a salad. Good choice when sightseeing in Berlin is your goal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ImogenH
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on TripAdvisor before making the decision to book, and don't regret it! Great boutique hotel with excellent facilities - above and beyond what we expected. We stayed for 3 nights and had nothing to complain about. The staff were extremely helpful, and all spoke English (and had a laugh about our German!). Breakfast, which was included in our package, was delicious and had a great selection of food. The U-Bahn is less than 5 minutes down the road (we used Weinmeisterstrasse, one stop from Alexanderplatz), and very easy to get the hang of, although we could've walked to most of the main attractions we wanted to see. The location is lovely, especially if you're looking to just wander around the city, with Alexanderplatz and Museum Island easily within walking distance. Overall, a fantastic trip - would definitely stay at the Amano again!

Reviews.Title: “Surprising hotel with great vibes!”
Reviews.Author: Gakeren
Reviews.Content: I read great reviews about this hotel before booking it,and something inside me told me I wasn't going to regret it! I came by myself for a short time (3 nights),and loved everything about this hotel! The location,the room with it's groovy shower,the friendly staff at the reception(Thanks to the red headed Sarah,who had loads of patience and great tips for me)nice hotel guests.... Actually,one of my top choices to recommend people who are traveling to Berlin! Keep up the good work hotel AMANO,and merry Christmas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JudgeJulesGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amano 16-19th Dec 2011 and loved every minute of it! The Hotel can be tricky to find... good tip - head to Rosenthaler Platz ubahn and head down the street where the TV tower is visible.. sounds daft but worked a treat as every ubahn has about 4-5 different exits! The rooms are funky with the shower actually in the room... not a problem if travelling as a couple. The beds are very comfortable and the room was warm and cosy for this time of the year. I really couldn't fault the rooms in any way, it was first class. Breakfast was fantastic, everything you could want and more. It is very busy at all times but we always found space to sit and eat. I take a busy restaurant as a good sign! Reception also friendly and helpful. The bar is stunning with good music and a good atmosphere... We just found it a little too expensive! Loved this hotel and would return if I visit Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Professional Bar Service”
Reviews.Author: Veronika D
Reviews.Content: Amano Hotel has a very nice bar that opens in the evenings. The atmosphere is glamurous and cozy at the same time. The waitering service is very professional anf friendly. The cocktails menu is various and not traditional, some of them are served in very particular way and this makes an experience even more attractive and unforgetable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: corrinnebarr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a slight pain to find however when we found it was very very impressed with the hotel overall for the money we had spent. One of the best things was the breakfast however it was always extrememly busy no matter what time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent,perfect!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: elena165 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: the best hotel in berlin!!!the staff very frendly,the breakfast delicious and the atmosphere so warm for these christmas days!!!We are naow in the hotel and we are writting all these!!!!!!!the perfect hotel in a perfect location!!!congratulations!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Book with confidence”
Reviews.Author: gardnas
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, comfortable and modern hotel in a great location. The reception staff are extremely helpful and can supply you with tour bus tickets and/or the Berlin pass for zones A & B (you need C if you're using it to go to Schonefeld airport). It is a two minute stroll from Rosenthaler Plaz where you will find the U Bahn and Tram stations (U Bahn U8, Trams M1 or M8) or, if you prefer to walk, it is a pleasant 10-15 min walk to Alexander Plaz with its fabulous Christmas markets. There is construction work outside the hotel but, although our room overlooked it, we were never disturbed by it. I promised Chris on reception a special mention because he was so welcoming and helpful throughout our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to attractions and shopping”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug2107
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last moment and got a very good deal. Stayed there for two nights before we headed back home and were very satisfied. Hotel very nicely decorated, rooms very clean, beds very comfortable. The hotel is walking distance to the subway and shopping - Alexanderplatz is just two stations away. Very helpful and courteous staff. Breakfast was good, ample choice, but the breakfast room is adjacent to lobby, not an enclosed place.

Reviews.Title: “Apartement Longterm Stay GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: peady z
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Amano last year for 6 weeks and lived in a two bedroom Apartement with very nice bathroom and living room. Room Service was great and the staff was very polite and always willing to help out. They handled everything very flexible and were fairly uncomplicated! Breakfast was very good but breakfast room was very crowded even in early hours. The hotel bar is trendy, pretty good bartenders, nice drinks and last year it was allowed smoking there...You have to try the sandwich shop right next to it "Luigi Zuckermann", He has gorgeous food and the staff is very cool.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stuey73
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in the Amano Hotel in Nov 2011 and was generally very happy. The hotel is very well decorated and styled to a higher standard then you woudl expect from a 3 star place. Staff were very helpful and attentive and the rooms were very nicely appointed and spotlessley clean. My only areas of minor dissatisfaction was that double rooms have wo beds next to each other rather than a large double, but the bed was very comfy and I slept very well. the buffet breakfast was very good and had an excellent range of hot and cold food. There is no restaurant, but there are plenty of really good places within a few minutes walk. The location is excellent in Mitte, an easy walk to Museum Island, Under den Linden etc or there are U-Bahn stations even closer if you don't fancy the walk or want to go further afield.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, staff could be more helpful”
Reviews.Author: LizardAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The location is great for walking to transportation, restaurants and shopping. I arrived very weary from a long, long trip. I checked in and was give a smoking room after I had specifically asked for non-smoking. I had to haul 3 bags back down to the lobby and downgrade my room to get a non-smoking room. The staff was not apologetic. The room was small but clean and fine (I was lucky not to be on the street construction side). Back your own shampoo and conditioner. All this hotel need is a concierge desk and a bell hop and it would be at the top of the list for Berlin. Book it but don't expect help with navigation or your bags. Do next door to Luigi for a cheaper and better breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Brigitte B
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband just returned from four days in Berlin. We stayed at the Amano hotel and are more than satisfied with this great hotel with only friendly staff in a brilliant location (ten minutes walk from Alexanderplatz northwards). The area is lively, with lots of places to eat. I couldn't think of anything that was wrong with this hotel! The price performance is just unbeatable: 100 % friendly staff, large and clean room, and vast breakfast buffet. What more do you want for a good price?

Reviews.Title: “amazing suite/apartment option”
Reviews.Author: NextTripStarts2row
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2 room apartment/suite in the adjoining building; we loved it and didn't want to leave! The rooms were €100 each/night (so £200 total per night) and double the size of our 2 bedroom flat in London. We were traveling with my in-laws visiting from America and this was a great set up because it allowed us to each have our own space but also spend time together. They are pretty tough hotel critics and they loved it as well (one of them travels extensively for work and is used to the perks of high-end American chain hotels). The apartment had a good sized bathroom, sitting room and kitchen. The kitchen could have had more glassware (like some wine glasses maybe?), but overall it was well equipped. There is a fridge, nespresso maker (you can get pods at the front desk) and a bakery and market around the corner so we could easily make our own breakfast spread. The breakfast downstairs is €15pp, so it was nice to have this option. The rooms are modernly decorated, an Urban Outfitters vibe if you will and plenty comfortable. I really loved the slippers included in the room, hard to describe them, but better than the standard white hotel slip-ons. My one complaint on something that actually impacted us was that, you need to speak with the front desk there was always a queue, but that aside, everything else was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a stay in Berlin Mitte”
Reviews.Author: 12Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: When in Berlin, I prefer to stay at the top-end hotels like Ritz-Carlton, Adlon or Interconti. For the first time I have stayed in one of the cheaper, more trendy hotels in Mitte, the Amano. First of all, it's great value for money, I had an appartment with fully equipped kitchen and seperate sleeping room for Euro 100,-/night. It felt like staying at home in Berlin on local living standards. Breakfast (Euro 11,-!!) is nice, good buffet with a lot of choice. Do not expect luxury or impaccable service, but it's great value for money and has a positive vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice value”
Reviews.Author: EP99
Reviews.Content: If you are interested in staying in Mitte (and I was) this is a fantastic location. The Circus hotel is even closer to the Rosenthaler Platz ubahn stop, but this is only a couple blocks away, not an issue at all. The rooms are modern and nicely, though sparsely decorated. As indicated in many reviews, the room is designed somewhat uniquely so that the shower is essentially in the room. Basically, the toilet is its own closet, then you have the sink and shower, then a desk, then the bed. It isn't as weird as it sounds, but it might be an issue if you are sharing the room (depending on whom you are sharing it with). My biggest problem with the room was the rather uncomfortable pillows, which provided no support. Wireless worked quite well in the rooms, as well as the lobby. Though some reviews described the front desk as uninterested, they seemed no different than the front desk staff at any hotel. I didn't take advantage, but the hotel bar is supposedly one of the best hotel bars around, and the rooftop portion has an amazing view of Alexanderplatz. I would definitely return, especially if traveling solo again. Good value, especially because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: elfbread
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. We managed to score a large room on the fourth floor that had two walls with floor to ceiling windows. We couldn't have asked for a better view or room! The location was also wonderful... very close to the Rosenthaler Platz station on the U8 and only a couple of stops from Alexanderplatz. It was really easy to get everywhere we wanted to go in the city. The staff wasn't overly friendly or rude, just average. The breakfast was complimentary which was nice, but we were often waiting around for dishes or for the juice machine to be refilled. This was only a small annoyance though. Luigi Zuckerman's deli next door served good food at a decent price. Would absolutely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: renee080
Reviews.Content: This a trendy and cool looking hotel and the decor is superbly done for the price you pay ! It is brilliantly located very near the u8 U-Bahn (Weinmeister-strasse) in Mitte and one stop from Alexander Platz. You can also stroll down to what is deemed the prettiest East Berlin neighbourhood called Prenzlauer Berg. The hotel itself is located near some bars, cafes (Luigi Zuckerman gourmet deli next door do yummy sandwiches!)and there is even a mini market opposite. The hotel breakfast buffet is 11 euros and adequately does the job of filling you up from eggs,bacon , cold cuts, cheese selection,cereal, yoghurts and a variety of bread. The only slight drawback is around peak time of 8.30-9am morning where you could be waiting 15 mins or more for some of the dishes to be replenished. The air conditioning in the room works very well and is a welcomed comfort when temperature outside is a sveltering 35 celsius. As this is classed as a " budget hotel" (although I personally would rate this a 4 star boutique hotel), there are no bathroom toiletries aside from shower gel.With a mini market across the road and the great value price you pay for the hotel, its a very small inconvenience . The hotel roof top bar is swanky and also gives a scenic view of Berlin against a backdrop of lounge music- I recommend this more than the downstairs bar . The garden as well is a great place to relax.The only negative comment is that whilst the hotel staff are friendly, not all can speak English well which can be tricky if you needed advise for directions or suggestions. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and would go back again !

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but Service Lacking”
Reviews.Author: Gail L
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location in East Berlin - near transportation stops and lots of activity. The hotel was a good value for us as we needed a two-bedroom apartment. They have a few apartment-type rooms and ours was clean and spacious. The bar downstairs is an excellent cocktail bar, and the rooftop bar was fun. Our major complaint was that the hotel has no concierge and the front desk was reluctant to help us with travel in the city. They only reluctantly helped us make some dinner reservations. And while the front desk staff was young, they did not appear to speak English well (despite the many young English speaking Germans in Berlin). Our microwave never worked, and while staff arrived to look at it, no one reported back (or fixed it during our stay). The elevator to our third floor was out for several days, and each time we reported it to the front desk, they acted surprised. So, if you want more service from your hotel staff, look elsewhere. The free wireless was great, except you had to get a new passcode each day, which was annoying for a 5-day stay (and something no other establishment has required).

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ameli_80
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days at Amano hotel and we really loved it. Small trendy with very clean rooms, great buffet breakfasts (perfect coffee machine) and very helpfulstaff. Around hotel you can find many bars and also is close to main attractions and U - S Bann. The room was small but sufficient, with safety box but don't prefer the first floor rooms who are abone the hotel 's bar it may sometime be noisy. The only negative I can say is the lack of fridge in the room and the high shower/bath that I couldn 't get out. I would reccomend this hotel and I will definetly stay there the next time I go back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartments and rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: lindri
Reviews.Content: We were 12 friends travelling to Berlin for a weekend, we stayed in both apartments for 2 and 3 people, and they were great. Lots of space, a small kitchen area, modern and bright. There was a huge selection at breakfast, and not to crowded. We spent two afternoons on the rootop terrace, which was great. Lots of places to sit and you could bring you own drinks/wine/beer, even though they had a bar up there. I liked the location of the hotel, quiet, with a short walk to the U-bahn, and shops and restaurants/bars. If you have not been to Berlin before, I would definitely stay in this part of town. The Amano bar is also great, a very popular place among locals. The only thing I would complain about, is that when I did not get my luggage at the airport you had to buy the toothbrush from a vendingmachine and they did not inform me at once when the luggage finally arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Defo stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Breezer83
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amano was just as descrbed and seen online. Rooms were small, very clean and had all you required. Garden, rooftop & bar where great! Staff spoke enough english to have basic communication which was fine. Location is fab, walking distance of just about everything! We used the train to get from Airport to Alexanderplatz and Hotel Amano is a 5-10 min walk. Great value for money. Would defo go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic new hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajsam
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel amano in the wallpaper guide to Berlin, it is tucked away in a quiet street in the Mitte district, but well located for getting around. We booked last minute and got a good rate that included breakfast. Room was quiet overlooking an inner courtyard, ultra modern open plan room and bathroom, but had everything you needed. Breakfast was good, nice selection of hot and cold food, coffee mediocre, served up to 11am. Great reception staff, good advice on local transport. Would recommend but not sure if you were paying published tariff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new, design-y place in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: caipirina
Reviews.Content: The first big plus, I am pretty certain we got a free upgrade from standard double to apartment (since we had indicated we travel with a child and according to their rules on a different booking site, they would provide a free extra bed for kids under 12, I think that's why we got the bigger room) The whole place and the rooms look great. The location is very convenient. Lots of nice bars and restaurants around. Look out for staying to close to the ground floor on weekends. Not only can you faintly hear the music from the Amano Bar, you can actually feel the thumb thumb thumb beat through the walls. We did not opt for breakfast (too expensive), there are some nice bakeries around and even open on Sundays. The staff was overall above average, the internet connection was not the fastest, but reliable (especiacially after I switched to Ethernet / Business center could use a scanner and a bit more fresh air). As for the rooftop terrrace: 10€ for Caipirinha makes you have only one, but come at the right time and enjoy a fantastic sunset. The Korean BBQ is so so in the garden ... better skip ahead and have 'Asian tapas' at Transit. I would absolutely come back. (If they fix the curtains, it got too bright in the morning)

Reviews.Title: “Wunderbar!”
Reviews.Author: satisfied_customer4
Reviews.Content: Just came home from a three-night-stay in Berlin and hotel Amano. We loved the hotel! Everything was good: a nice, clean hotel located in a perfect place. The staff was friendly and helpful most of the time. The room was small, but nice and had everything necessary. The breakfast was very good. The roof terrace and garden restaurang (with Korean BBQ) were cosy and nice. The location was perfect - near subway station and a short walk to Hackescher Markt. We would definitely choose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Really wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: missippy
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by hotel Amano. We booked a medium sized apartment which was more than enough room for 2 people. Ours had a terrance which was a feature we did not expect but really enjoyed. The staff is reserved but very helpful, and the hotel is minimally decorated but very clean and lovely. Finally, the location was excellent- in the Mitte and close to a lot of great shopping and eating. Next time we go to Berlin, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect position- will be back”
Reviews.Author: Athertonlad1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Octopus travel and was pleasantly surprised on arrival. It is a very modern hotel with attached bar and built on I think 5 floors with a roof bar. We were given a double room on the 1st floor (near the lift) which was enormous and had a disabled bathroom with a "wet room shower". Air conditioning worked well and the breakfast buffet was very good. So much so that no food was needed at lunch time. Tremendous location between Alexanderplatz, Hackesher Markt, close to all the main sites which are in the old Eastern sector. 400 metres from the Cathedral and 300metres from the main rail hub, both U bahn and S Bahn very close by. The location cannot be beaten. Trust me it's great!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Clean and Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cquad40
Reviews.Content: We had a great tiime at this nice hotel, close to Alexanderplatz. Very clean, modern, good breakfast and free wifi. Staff is ok and good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Mitte - what else”
Reviews.Author: BonnieClyde2024
Reviews.Content: If you go to Berlin, stay in Mitte. If you look for a hotel in Mitte, stay in Amano. Very nice, tiny but clean, wooden floors (in the room), creative bathrooms, calm but centrally located. The roof-top bar is another highlight - if you want to relax in an atmosphere that is typical for Berlin. Value for money - perfect! Staff was kind of caotic but friendly. Therefore not 5 but 4 points.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, weird bathroom arrangements..”
Reviews.Author: fbdublin
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, in a cool part of town, really near TV tower, Hackescher Markt, great local small bars and restaurants. V modern and slick design, which as usual ends up feeling a little impersonal. Don't hire their bikes, they are really uncomfortable and have crappy gears - you'll do better up the street from the real bike shop on Auguststrasse. The room was very small, but comfy beds, sharp white sheets and new design feel - super duper clean. The shower and sink are in the bedroom however, with only the toilet separate, and this was a downside for us, would have preferred a real bathroom. Also very little space to put anything down - our bags were on the floor all weekend. But the location is gorgeous, it feels pretty swanky, and Berlin is so fantastic you won't be in your room much. We got a great deal on 1800hotels.ie, check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms, no place to put anything”
Reviews.Author: lynn09
Reviews.Content: Had to upgrade to an apartment in order to have room just to put a suitcase down. Were told when booking the rooms included breakfast but found out late it did not.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, functionable & good value for money”
Reviews.Author: LOU222
Reviews.Content: Service was the only thing that really let this hotel down, the reception staff were rude and made us feel like we were an inconvenience for the entire stay. The room was modern and minimal, clean and funtionable and good value for money, the gem find was the roof terrace with 360° views. The hotel has a great location, in a trendy part of town, was perfect for site-seeing and restaurants. We would recommend the hotel for a weekend break in this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and well located.”
Reviews.Author: PaulineBelgium
Reviews.Content: We booked a regular room at Hotel Amano. The room was not too small, was very clean. The hotel is very well located, in an quiet area. The hotel also provides bikes at a good price. Good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: rossella91
Reviews.Content: We booked in december it for a few monei. the hotel is located 2 stops from the tv tower and other attractions. in the dai time we walked to get there. Around u can find little pubs and few restaurants if u would like to stai closer for dinner time. u won't need a lunch cause the breakfast is amazing. there was everithing!!! fruit, fruit salad, mani different cereals and jam and jogurt, eggs, rice, sausages and other salad stuff was cooked at the moment and it was hot and nice to smell. Mani sweets, also and absoluteli furnished of beverages and drinks! When things were finished the waitress brought back new things. The food wasa good qualiti. The room was large and had a modern design, the bathroom was big and confortable. Soap was there and mani towels too.The room was clean and the bed veri soft. We enjoied our permanence there. I think it worth a lot. The staff has been alwais kind to answer to our needs. We demanded 2 coverts more because in the night was a bit cold and thei brought them immediateli. To give an idea...in the toilet near the hall there were food machines!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: goodtraveller85
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! Modern, warm, clean and wide rooms, kind staff... breafkast was super, you can really chose anything you wish! It was a full-full-full buffet breakfast served in a spacious breakfast area in the ground foor. Location is perfect, you can walk and reach in a few minutes the Dome or you can walk and arrive to the underground station. Rooms are modern - as in general the style of the hotel - and very clean. The only strange things: shower is inside the room, so shower walls are transparent and from the room you can see your partner taking the shower. For my husband and I, no problem... but maybe for our friends who were not partners, this could have been a little bit embarrassing! Anyway, we definitely suggest to go there!

Reviews.Title: “More than fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Haintchen
Reviews.Content: Great Service, exceptionally clean, wonderful staff, free newspapers, perfect location, and, most important, terrific price. The neighborhood is not far from two different tram lines and is full of delicious restaurants. Our favorite was actually part of the Hotel building, Luigi Zuckerman's Deli. They have great coffee and the best Chocolate Croissant! This hotel was the perfect way to enjoy the hip, young city that Berlin is.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Good Location, Lack of Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Homesick_Alien
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed here on a weekend trip to Berlin. Overall we were quite impressed with the Hotel Amano. First impressions were that the stylish lobby area with its designer seats and sofas and designer chess boards was completely lacking in any real atmosphere. In fact one was left with the impression that there really were not very many people staying at the hotel, which may or may not have been the case. The staff at reception were efficient but I would not describe them as friendly. The room, despite being small, we really liked, possibly due to its unusual lay out - the huge shower is in the bedroom as opposed to being in a separate bathroom, and nice designer touches throughout. However our "double room" was simply 2 single beds pushed together (this is one of my pet peeves in hotels). Location is great. the U-bahn is a 3 minute walk away and Rosenthaler Platz and its surroundings is a very chic and trendy neighbourhood with some lovely restaurants and cafés and boutique clothes shops.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: hitravlr
Reviews.Content: Good location in Berlin and nice interior design, but service is poor and missing even the basics: - no bath amenities! (just body soap) - floor in the rooms is worn down and dirty, and hotel does not provide slippers. i.e. you are forced to walk around in your street shoes after taking a shower - staff is friendly but does not make an effort to help you. * asked for hair shampoo - sorry we cannot help you * can you tell me a shop where I can buy hair shampoo? - sorry shops are closed already, cannot help you * asked for slippers - sorry we don't have that - although we booked the more expensive apartment room, we got a normal room. Only after asking we were changed into the apartment we actually booked. - beds are uncomfortable. low quality furniture, although still new already worn down. The downsides may have been excusable, but since the staff didn't even show some understanding of the problems, it left us with a bad aftertaste.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ernie4you
Reviews.Content: There is not much to say, as everything is just close to perfect. It is 100 meter from Underground (Rosenthaler Platz), nice trendy rooms with design shouer and sink, good buffet breakfast, automat with almost everything you could have forgotten to take from home (from toothbrush to play cards and throw away camera), friendly service, rooms are clean, calm street, parking spots in the cellar, tv, hair dryer, soap, safety box. They even have appartments if you want to cook for yourselves. Only ask for an additional pillow as they are quite soft. Rooms are compact. Appartments we've seen are very spacy. Just perfect for money; nothing to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be conned by the slick website!”
Reviews.Author: Aussietravellers01
Reviews.Content: It’s easy to be bewitched by the slick website of this hotel and it does have a lovely lobby area and it is very well located but it is also very over priced for what you get. We booked through Expedia.com and even though we looked at the hotel website, the photos are taken so that you don’t get a clear view of the rooms. It is also not apparent from the website that there are several different types of rooms, as we discovered during our expensive pre-paid five night stay. The first room that we were given was very small and like all the rooms, with very little storage space, and it wasn’t mentioned that the shower and basin were actually in the bedroom space and had no privacy at all. We complained the next day and were moved to another room late in the day. This time, there was a separate bathroom, but the room was ridiculously small. After further complaints, they admitted that it was an exceptionally small room and for the rest of our stay, they moved us to one of their apartment rooms, which was fine but definitely not what you would expect if you had booked and pre-paid for an apartment in the first instance. Another issue that we had was the incredibly hard beds which they have… like sleeping on the floor! We definitely would choose a different hotel in the same area if we return to Berlin in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JPopiel
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Nice, clean, location close to the metro. Very friendly service, free WiFi access and a tasty breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel (which could easily be Greater !)”
Reviews.Author: wayneyboy35
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with this hotel for the following reasons: The hotel is actually more contemporary and stylish than it appears on their own website. The images they use don't do the place justice and in this, I think the hotel has missed an opportunity ! The immediate location is excellent, with bars, galleries and a real 'arty' feel, which pleased us greatly. ( Up the road just by the U-bahn station is an excellent takeaway place which shares asian and italian business with tables in the middle - eat there it is fantastic and atmospheric !) We also had completely free internet access in the room which is really important to us and felt that this was superb considering it was free. The hotel was good value for money for us as we booked through a discount hotel site some time in advance and paid around £350 for 4 nights with breakfast - nearer to the time, this would have increased to around £800 without breakfast and I am not sure the hotel would have been worth that. Some points that the hotel might want to consider .... I didn't think that the absence of tea/coffee facilities in the room would have been a problem, but I really did miss this - I think it is poor of the hotel not to supply this. Also - some other reviewers have mentioned the basic style of the rooms - we didn't mind this, but ours was beyond basic bordering on austere ! Luckily we love the bauhaus style - but be prepared ! More habitat than Ikea decor-wise actually, but not even a canvas picture on the very bare wall ! It was also a room which you could have smoked in - we are both non-smokers but were never asked for a preference. To be fair, it did not smell of smoke but the corridor immediately outside did. Our large window faced an outside bar area where, at certain times of the year (Summer ?), could presumably have been noisy and intrusive. We didn't concern ourselves with any of this due to the bargain booking - had we paid more we may have questioned the rooms location and smoking status. Further points - the help yourself breakfast was extensive and really good - we were never asked for our room number so could have wandered in off the streets which was a little strange ! We were also intrigued how you shared the coffee with strangers on your table, and one day had to clear the previous guests debris to the other end of our table ourselves, where it remained for the duration of our breakfast ! The hot food, bacon, eggs and sausage, were served in 3 large bowls - they were delicious, however, at NO time during the 4 days we ate there were the three items available all at once and we had to wait for eggs for a considerable time on one day in particular - there was really little attention paid to supplying plates as well, so as other reviewers have noted, it was very much self-service and sort things out for yourselves ! I got a little tired of having to continually ask the staff for things at breakfast time - they were pleasant enough but still seemed to concentrate on things that didn't matter or stock up on food items which were already available . I would stay there again providing the prices we paid were still available, but would have complained more if we had paid what I am guessing some people had. One final thing .... and it is really trivial I guess .... the hotel knew from the details I had to complete on arrival, that it was a special birthday for me during my stay. I would have thought the hotel might have had a standard card for this - but yet another opportunity was missed ! I realise that all of this sounds quite negative, but I actually thought the hotel was very good indeed - none of it spoilt my experience and I really enjoyed my stay - it is just that the extra attention to some of these points would have made it even better and in this, I think the organisation have missed a trick ....

Reviews.Title: “Well-located and staff is friendly but...”
Reviews.Author: TokyoEric
Reviews.Content: Well-located and staff is friendly but room prices are high compared to nearby hotels like The Circus. Seems to be popular with German business people & international tourists. Rooms are large & nicely furnished. Internet is free but a bit of a hassle with log-on codes each day. Lobby was large, trying to be hip, but usually empty. I like the location and the hotel is OK but not great value compared to some of the other offerings in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, friendly and comfy”
Reviews.Author: Em_Bedford
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights as part of honeymoon. Excellent value for money was surprised it was 3 star as had 4 star lobby, breakfast and room although no kettle!) Room clean, comfy bed and good sized bathroom. Modern design throughout hotel. Excellent choice at breakfast including a fab hot drinks machine which I enjoyed sampling all the variants of fancy coffees! Had a lovely romantic evening on the roof terrace with excellent service and views over the city. Staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel in interesting Jewish quarter and U bahn 4 mins walk away. 24 hour deli next to hotel great spot for cheap eats.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest places I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: DeliciousJane
Reviews.Content: Came to Berlin on a 4 day trip to visit my eldest son who lives here. Travelling with relatives and 3 children under 10, we'd all booked seperate rooms however when we arrives, the girl on reception suggested we all share an apartment which worked out far cheaper. The hotel is simply beautiful and when we walked in we couldnt help but be strucvk by the sleek , clean design of the loby and bar areas. As well as single and family rooms, the hotel also provides 2 and 3 bedroom apartments which are modern, spacious, clean and immaculately furnished. Ours contained two huge bedrooms, an enormous sitting room, a bathroom and fully functioning kitchen. The staff went out of their way to help and the breakfast was out of this worls - sucvh a huge choice which we could eat indoors or in the lovely garden. There's also a trendy rooftop terrace for chilling out at night with a barman on hand to mix cocktails. We got all this including breakfast (and the kids ate free) for 160 euro a night for 5 of us. What a fantastic high season deal. This wouldbe the hotel I returned to when I visit this fantastic city again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel- great value, great location, great room!”
Reviews.Author: msmith1
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for a weekend break. The location was brilliant (2 minute walk to Hackesche Market, filled with bars, cafes and restaurants) and easily accessible by S bahn and buses. We managed to get to and from the airport in half an hour via train and bus! The hotel was clearly very new/newly renovated. It's very unassuming from the street- as soon as you walk in to the reception you're consumed by a trendy feel. There is a good bar and a lovely roof garden with outdoor sofas and cushions etc. The twin rooms were lovely, potentially a tiny bit on the small side. It was bright, had a great view of the street, very clean and furniture and decor were new. The only strange thing would be the bathroom- the toilet was behind a separate door but the shower unit was in the main part of the room fronted only by glass. It wasn't a problem for us but definitely could be for two people sharing a room who weren't particularly close or did not want to reveal themselves so easily. On the whole, the hotel staff were very helpful. They phoned attractions and restaurants for us and held our baggage when our room was not ready. I would advise to specify an early check in. We arrived at the hotel at half 12 in the afternoon, and they said the earliest our room would be ready was 4pm (quite late in hotel terms). Breakfast was the best part! A full continental breakfast buffet was included in our rate and it was more than substantial with a huge range of choice and a fair few vegetarian options (hard to come by in Germany with all their meats!). We even managed to sneak some away for elevenses snacks! I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gskumt
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great breakfast. Booked a single room, got a double room which was fine. Nice Hotelbar, a bit pricely compared to the bars in the area. Only thing I dislike is the new trend to put the shower in the room, fine if you are a couple travelling but a bit odd if you are two friends travelling. My preferred hotel in east Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “OK.”
Reviews.Author: dessislava
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel two hours earlier and they gave us the room straight away and checking in was straight forward. Room was modern, with bath and liquid soap and shower gel. Double bed was two single beds pushed together each one with a separate duvet cover- I just hate when they do that!!! TV had around 20 channels. Room was relatively small, we had no kettle in the room. Room had a safe. The garden in this hotel was lovely and they had a swing and also there was a open terace on the roof with a bar and a lovely view of the main tower. Room was maintained clean throughout our stay. Breakfast was OK but the girls serving in the dining room looked really miserable all the time and they just seemed to wander around and not clear any of the tables, so people had to sit and eat their breakfast surrounded by dirty plates and cups. One of the girls in particular was really annoyed with some gests because she had to change the milk in the coffee machine and the next day she was annoyed again with some other guests for the same reason. The next day I asked one of the girls for some croissants but they never came. Apart from the attitude of some of the breakfast staff our stay was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: euro_traveller12328
Reviews.Content: It looks good on the internet and some of the reviews here are clearly written by staff at the hotel - basically it's an Ikea style hotel, no bedside tables, 2 towels, 2 pillows, rooms are beige, you need to get a 'ticket' to use the internet every day, some lights don't work - but the really annoying thing is the service - they hire these 20'something girls and guys that really don't give a sh*t, because the hotel is 'self-serve' they have probably been told to keep service to a minimum so that you don't rely on the front desk - no concierge etc, we ask for a restaurant recommendation within walking distance and they picked one at random after googling 'restaurants around Hotel Amano' and then showed us the screen LOL. They have a nice bar upstairs but the chairs are cheap wicker and some of them have the bottoms falling out..so basically don't stay here unless you really have to or friends are staying..there are so many hotels in Berlin and I've stayed at a lot of them, some are hit and some are miss - this one is a miss..

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: nicktgb
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second visit to Berlin, staying again at the Hotel Amano. It is excellently located close to Hackescher Markt and Alexanderplatz, and our rooms - which were actually mini-apartments with fridge, dishwasher and mini-cooker - were spotlessly clean, superbly decorated and very comfortable. The breakfasts, which were included in our room rate, were outstanding. This hotel is exceptional value for money. I hope to return to Berlin soon, and would not really consider staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Amano may be minimalist but very good!”
Reviews.Author: JMOP1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a city break in Berlin where we stayed in the Hotel Amano with a large group of friends. The staff on the reception are very helpful and pleasant, booking restaurants and checking out availability for us. The hotel is very well situated for the east side of the city and visiting all the major historical sites. It is also within walking distance of Alexanderstrasse and Plaza for shopping. While there are trams and a good network of trains and buses, consider using taxis as they are very reasonably priced particularly when there is a number of people sharing the taxi. It is possible to book a taxi for 6 and 8 people. Breakfast in the hotel is excellent. All food is fresh and there is a very good variety to suit all tastes. There is a bar in the hotel which is busy and lively and adds to the atmosphere of the Amano. Bedrooms are small, minimalist but adequate. Beds are comfortable. Storage space is kept to a minimum.The shower opens into the bedroom directly and the toilet is in a closed area. Toiletries are not provided free but there is a vending machine in the hotel that supplies some requisites and there is a small supermarket nearby across the road. However, this hotel is excellent value. The standard of cleanliness is very high and there is a feeling of openness and freshness in the room. All the historical sites are worth visiting. Afternoon tea in the Adlon Hotel is a treat after visiting the Brandenburg Gate and nearby sights. Better to book beforehand. The open-air hop on, hop off bus is a good way of seeing the sites and then return to the ones that one finds more interesting. A great way of seeing many areas of this vast city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice design. Big rooms”
Reviews.Author: richeyint
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice and comfortable, not very clean though. Bar service was 5* but reception service was very very poor. I was shocked that there were no WC amenities except for a showergel, shampoo?? (not identified) fixed on the wall. I will come back again

Reviews.Title: “Design, value, location, service”
Reviews.Author: vl59
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights. The hotel with very unusual design - young and modern. Situated in distance of five minutes walk from Alexanderplatz, 12 minutes walk from Friederichstrasse, 300 m from Underground Station. Next to tram line, but with good soundproof. The breakfast is very reach. Helpful staff. A lot of restaurants in this area. Italian one is very recommended - especially for scampi risotto. Only two negative factors - we didn't love pillows and no minibar in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brimae
Reviews.Content: Just back from trip to Berlin - stayed 3 nights at the Amano Hotel - so well located in the Mitte District with wonderful restaurants and bars very close by. The Amano is very modern in style, with very clean rooms, great buffet breakfasts and staff are very helpful - no matter what the query !! Perfect place to stay whilst visiting Berlin

Reviews.Title: “minamilist decor, minamilist service”
Reviews.Author: hanagirl
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, this hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Mitte, with easy access the U-bahn and in a great area full of galleries, restuarants, and interesting trendy shops. The hotel is new and stylish, with attractive minamilist decor. The breakfast is great, German style, with a large selection of breads, fruits, juices, cheeses, cold meats, cereals, eggs etc. However, potential visitors should be aware that this is not a full service hotel. There is no room service. There will be no shampoo or other amenities in your room. You will carry your own bags. You cannot call the front desk from your room to ask for something. Once you check in, you are on your own. This hotel seems to be trying for a new concept aimed towards a younger crowd, by providing the things they really value, like free WLAN and a happening bar scene, while eliminating the things their parents are accustomed to, like little bottles of shampoo in the bathrooms or restaurant recommendations. (Although there is a nicely designed brochure in the room with sightseeing information and you can rent an ipod with Berlin tips and information as well) My room was a small apartment on the top floor, very comfortable and quiet, with a rooftop view of Berlin. I can imagine some of the other rooms would be noisy, nearer the bar, for example. I was very happy here, because of the location and the price. I will stay here again, as I have friends in the neighborhood and it works well for me. However, there are lots of new hotels in Mitte. It would be worth checking them out as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: SamB77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in February 2010 and it was an excellent hotel. Easy to get to from the airport and on good underground links, also easy to walk to Alexanderplatz station, though the Rosenthaler Underground is closer at just a couple of minutes walk. The hotel is new and very nicely decorated, the breakfast was delicious and had plenty of choice, the staff were exceptionally helpful with contacting theatres etc to make bookings and advising on directions, places to eat and the bus tour. The room we were in wasn't huge, but it was ample, very clean and comfy and the bathroom was spotless. They don't appear to provide shampoo so you will need to bring your own, but they did have shower gel. The only downside was that it is positioned right on top of an underground line and you could hear the trains going past about every 5 minutes in the day time and evening. That said, with a pair of earplugs in you couldn't hear them at all, and if you are used to a noisy environment it might not bother you at all. Coming from a quiet village I really notice any noise, but as I said, the earplugs meant it wasn't a bother. I would happily stay here again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Better than 3 star, great location”
Reviews.Author: stipeKerry
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, fantastic location for any major atraction in Berlin. The hotel is very modern, fairly simple but clean and rooms are fine if a little on the small side. Bathrooms are part of the room so if you are sharing with someone you don't know that well it could cause problems. Breakfast was plentiful with lots of choice. Favourite part of the hotel for me was the bar, very popular at weekends with local trendys, decent chill out music in background by DJ and a brilliant cocktail menu, if expensive. Overall would really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL, STAFF, BREAKFAST,BEST OF ALL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: konsara
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for 5days in this hotel.From 1st 2010 to 5th 2010. 1)The location is the best, in 150meters from the U(metro)station Rosenthaler Platz, and near the S-bahn (Railway)Heckescher Markt(200meters) that you can visit Potsdam City SanSouci Friedrich Palace in 30minutes with S7 to Potsdam. Alexander Platz is 10minutes walk from the hotel. 2) Around the hotel are a lot of "bars" with very young people so you will not be afraid of anything if you visit Berlin for the first time.Also, the hotel hat a nice bar near the hotel. 3)Very kind staff.Every day clean up my room.Reception help me to find my way to visit Berlin.They give us our room immediately. 4)Very good breakfast and until 11pm.(eggs,omelete,4kindsof hams,3 kinds of cheese, marmelade,jogurt,milk,donuts,coffe mashine, very nice chocolate and espresso.etc) 5)Very nice rooms with safety box.

Reviews.Title: “great location and price, but poor and sometimes rude service at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: yodellady
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an XL apartment with young children. Good size and very clean. Lifts stopped only in between floors, which was not convenient with heavy luggage. No help was offered from staff in carrying bags. Hotel is in a great location, is well priced and rooms are comfortable if somewhat spartan. Service is minimal. You're pretty much on your own upon check in. Front desk staff was at times incompetent (they didn't know our lost baggage had arrived) and sometimes down right rude. Still, we would stay here again just for the location, price, and availability of apartments. It is good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Warmly welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Stephengg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days during a very cold spell in December (daytime temps -14C max). The hotel was warm and friendly: reception was efficient and always helpful, the bar well stocked, and public seating and breakfast areas comfortable. The rooms themselves were minimalist, but better for that (made a nice difference from the identikit rooms offered by the big chains). Beds possibly the most comfortable of any hotel we've stayed at. The inclusive buffet breakfast would offer something for everyone, and was a good way to kick off along and cold day. The location is quite good: between two nearby U-Bahn stations and within walking distance of Alexanderplatz. A very few minor negatives: on a promotion night, the bar became very crowded, very noisy and very smoky. I'm used to the UK's ban on smoking in public areas, and think the bar would be improved by a similar ban. And my sons were none too impressed by the clear glass shower door - may be more of a problem for friends sharing a room than couples. And it sits close to a tram line and over a U-bahn line, which meant that the rumbling of a passing train or tram could be heard particularly in the early morning, but tis was far from intrusive or disturbing. On the whole, we're really pleased that we stayed here, and at the end of a long, cold day of sight-seeing, the sign above the door was so welcoming to get back to.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best we've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: raclou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December 2009. We were expecting a hotel room, but instead we got more of an apartment, which made the stay much better. The room was very modern, it had a fairly large bathroom with shower/bath, a kitchenette with sink, oven, dishwasher, fridge, coffee facilities and kitchen utensils, two comfy seats and a kitchen table. The bedroom - bigger than most hotel rooms - big king bed, plenty of cupboard space. The hotel had a lift to the hotel rooms, while we went further through and went to a door that seems out of the way and had to climb up 2 flights of narrow stairs with luggage to our room. The breakfast served was excellent. Good selection. Modern environment. Free Internet was a good bonus. Had to get a little coupon from Reception with username/password. Worked well too. The location - not too bad. It was about a 10 minute walk to the alexanderplatz train station, and from there it was quick enough to get to the hauptbahnhof. Around the hotel, we didn't find much to do, there is a pharmacy, supermarket and post office close by. About 10 mins walk there was a big Christmas Market which was nice. We found the service of the people who worked there friendly but didn't need to speak to them that much, plus there was the language barrier (dont speak german). We've stayed in about 7 hotels in Europe so far (within a few months) and this one was definatly one of the better ones.

Reviews.Title: “great location, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmepani
Reviews.Content: This is a stylish but comfortable hotel. the underground is just down the road as are a number of restaurants. Breakfast was not included but this was not an issue as there is 24hr cafe just around the corner The rooms are spacious and the one we stayed in had a kitchenette. The hotel rooms are also designed to accommodate wheel chair access would not hesitate to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money even for highly discerning travellers.”
Reviews.Author: chgandhi
Reviews.Content: We were three guys who stayed at the Amano for 2 nights during our 4 nights at Berlin. The location was an advantage, all the happening places in Mitte were walking distance. We stayed in the apartments managed by the hotel. The apartment was decent sized with 2 proper bedrooms and large living room with a kitchenette and dining within it. There is an elevator in the building, but it stops on the intermittent floors so you either you have to climb up or go down half a flight of stairs with your suitcases to reach your apartment. The decor was modern and clean and the high ceiling height gave the place very cool and comfortable aesthetics. The layout of the apt. could have been better, but I guess these are very old structures and the major refurbishments would have to be limited to the superficial. The main bathroom and toilet was large and well appointed, but the other loo was only a powder room, so need to plan the showers. We did not use the restaurant at the hotel, but it seemed to be pretty full at meal times. The staff at the front desk was polite and helpful, especially in calling us cabs in the wee hours of the morning and giving us directions. Overall we loved our stay cuz for Euro 125 + taxes a night for the apartment, we guys couldn’t have for more. Would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - friendly, clean and brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: EnglandColumbus
Reviews.Content: Excellent modern Hotel in brilliant location near Harkesher Markt train station - which is buzzing at all times. Local bars and restaurants plentiful cater for all tastes and budgets. We stayed 3 nights - best tip was doing a Original Walking Tour from Harkesher Markt on our first morning. We used info gleaned on this tour to set the agenda for the rest of our stay! Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Hanimani
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Amano for thwo nights with my mother. Amano is a very nice new hotel. It' s very centrally located, easy access to public transportation. Lots of great restaurants and cafes nearby. Our room was on the 5th floor, quiet and fairly spacious (two separate beds). The only minus were the beds, which were extremely hard.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel with some design flashes and flaws!”
Reviews.Author: Joizee_HD
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night. The positive things is that I paid €90 for the night (not including breakfast) and found the location to be perfect. Further, the place, still being fairly new is clean. On the other hand, the room was quite small and very simple. As someone already mentioned, there was a cramped table and a stool (tiny) but no chair or much space to move around in the room. I was also on the side facing the Rosenthaler Strasse and actually did hear street noise. Not too bad but not completely muted out. I also found service at the reception lackluster. One of the ladies was downright rude and the other incompetent, as if it were her first day. Took forever to check in and lucky for me, they were there when I checked out. Took long as well and the line was at least 6 deep when I joined it. Nevertheless, the location is really good and the price as well. Will I be back? Well maybe, if I need to be right there in the area. I also like the free wireless so it's a good base to work from. Yet, in Berlin you have so many other options in the immediate area that this one won't spring to mind immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!! I wouldn't stay anywhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyIsrael
Reviews.Content: Wow. This hotel is amazing!!! Even more than in photos, from the moment I entered till check-out, I had FUN in it. I was shocked when I went into the room. Most beautiful hotel room I've ever been to. The design is fantastic, like the rest of the hotel. The room was very quiet, always extra-clean, and the comfort bed + bid pillows were so nice. I have no idea why this hotel is only 3 stars rated. Only thing was that the rooms wasn't ready on time, but about an hour after that, but my bag was kept at reception so it wasn't a big deal. though I was tired cause I had a night flight to Berlin... Breakfast was delicious with good service. Buffet is rich and fresh. Hotel location was ideal for me, since it was my second time in Berlin (but first in this brand new hotel) and I knew I want to be close to Mitte (hotel is actually IN the Mitte) and Prenzlauer Berg (5 minutes by foot). Also, it is 10 minutes by foot to Museum Island and very close to Unter den Linden + Brandenburg Gate. To the west side of the city - Kudamm+KaDeWe you need to go by transportation, about 13-15 Euros by Taxi. Staff were helpful and answered any question I had with a smile. They were very sweet and thier English was good. On the last floor there is an amazing roof with sofas, the weather was good and it was absolutely amazing sitting there. Really, the hotel was just perfect, I was amazed by it and no doubt I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kristin2
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly suprised by Hotel Amano. Since it was rather cheap, we thought that the quality of the hotel would be lower. But this is a really great hotel! It looks very nice and trendy. The rooms are clean, simple and the beds were very comfortable. I think the location was great too. Not far from U-bahn, and close to shopping and restaurants. Its walking distance to Heckesher markt. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone and I will definetly stay there the next time I go back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and comfortable hotel right in the middle of Mitte Berlin”
Reviews.Author: earlybird44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Amano at the end of August. It had no reviews when I booked the room as it just opened on August 13. When I arrived at 4 pm my room was not ready but after some discussion I was given another room on the second floor along the Rosenthaler Strasse. The room was small but nicely laid out with two closets to hang up and put your stuff away. There was also a small safe which you can close with your own code. I like the design of the room, spotless white walls, light oak parquet floor, a comfortable double bed with white linnens, soft pillows, a bit too soft actually, and nice light fixtures. The windows are double glazed and have double curtains, one sheer metallic grey and one opaque grey made of a heavy satin. There's a flat screen tv on the wall but the colors of the tv were way off, and I did not know how to fix that with the remote control which had a thousand buttons. Here and there were day-glow pink accents repeated elsewhere in the hotel which worked very well. Nice bathroom with a bath and shower, slate floor tiles and spotlessly clean. Plenty of towels, which were refreshed once during my 3-night stay. Also a hairdryer and a mirror that enlarges your face. Good for plucking stray hairs! Or shaving. Beautiful bathroom fixtures. A heavy door kept all noise out. To get the light and airco working you have to place your room key in the form of a credit card into a slot. When you take it out it shuts off the lights and air conditioning. Spacious lobby with Turkish divans upholstered in grey velvet and some nice old patchwork rugs. Adjacent to the lobby where you pick up one of many Berlin newspapers (all in German) is the breakfast room with many different seating arrangements, one long wooden table surrounded by wooden chairs painted pink day-glow and lovely Hortensia flowers in glass cut vases. For breakfast you could choose from scrambled eggs, sausages and crisply fried bacon, cold cuts, cheeses, lovely jams, and all kinds of breads and danish. There is a great-looking coffee machine which dispenses all kinds of fancy coffees, a choice of teas, juices and pots with regular coffee. Off the hallway to the courtyard there's a little space with two computers with free internet access. When you go to the fifth floor you can walk up two flights of stairs and take a look at the skyline of Berlin from the roof terrace with divans along side, charpoy beds with metallic woven strings, and even a hammock where I dozed off one late afternoon. I rented a bike from the hotel and zipped around Berlin, a great way to visit all of the landmarks without busting your feet. The bike had a basket on the back to put my bag and a big lock so I could fasten the bike to one of the myriad bike stands in the city. It sure was wonderful to go from the hotel to the Staatsoper in 10 minutes and zip back after the fireworks were over. It felt very free and easy and fast and I did not have to deal with figuring out U & S Bahn and bus schedules and stops. With a good map you'll find your way around the city very quickly. The wifi was handy to check mail but each time I wanted to use it I had to enter code and password again. The people working at Armano were very friendly and helpful, one girl brought me my cappuccino on the roof terrace one morning. Right around the corner are inexpensive restaurants and Rosenthalerstrasse is full of interesting shops and clubs. Also important, I felt very safe in the neighborhood of the hotel. Everywhere were little bars and restaurants with people enjoying the balmy evenings. The hotel also has a bar and some chairs and table on the sidewalk. I would have loved to stay longer and I will be planning another trip soon. Berlin is fascinating and the hotel Amano is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel was incrediable!!”
Reviews.Author: flocks
Reviews.Content: this hotel was amazing! modern architecture with beautiful surroundings close to everything!! my husband and i stayed there for 3 nights and it was great! the staff were extremely friendly and multi-lingual which was good for us because neither of us spoke a word of german! the buffet breakfast was well worth the 11 euro, and the overall price for the apartment was quite competitive. it is situated right near hackersher markt station and only a 5 min train ride from the main centre station. there are some amazing restaurants that are only a 2 min walk down the road. overall we will definitely be coming back here when we return to berlin!! oh yeah, and free wifi throughout the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel , great stuff , i'll be back !!”
Reviews.Author: pelegeli
Reviews.Content: me and my family stayed for four nights, we came very early (7 a.m) and the nice lady at The desk gave us one room although the check in time is at 3 p.m. in the last day the other nice lady let us keep the room, free of charge, until 4 p.m (our flight was at 7 p.m)although the check out time is at 12 p.m Beautiful decorating magazine like rooms, good location, good restaurants nearby. Metro station nearby, very good cafes, bars, jazz club, stores nearby. Bad points?? Maybe the breakfast service could be faster.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, New Hotel, Good Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: pstadnick
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the Amano Hotel. The hotel is brand new, so the facilities are quite nice and modern. I booked an apartment, so my room was on the 5th floor and pretty spacious. However, the bathroom floor wasn't very clean. The other negative point was that the staff seemed really lost. I believe they had been recently hired, so they couldn't give a very good level of service. I arrived at the hotel at 3pm and my room was not ready, and they acted like it was normal. I also queued a long time to do the check in, and although there were over 7 people at the desk, none would look at me as they were all running around. Overall 'though, the location is really convenient, as you can walk to Alexanderplatz. I would stay again in spite of the poor service.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Amano
HotelInfo.Address: Auguststrasse 43 | junction Rosenthaler Strasse, 10119 Berlin, Germany
